metadata.title: CVE-2019-9819 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A vulnerability where a JavaScript compartment mismatch can occur while working with the fetch API, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
